intro: Monolophus arunachalensis, commonly known as the Arunachal Himalayan bellflower, is a flowering plant native to the eastern Himalayas. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pale blue. The plant typically grows in alpine meadows and rocky slopes at high altitudes, showcasing its adaptation to cold and arid conditions. Its leaves are usually lanceolate and covered with a dense layer of fine hairs, which helps in reducing water loss. Monolophus arunachalensis plays a significant role in the ecological balance of its habitat, supporting various pollinators and contributing to the biodiversity of the region.
